chargeHist.descr: Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan A. Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.075(1r).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS ELIGIBLE for Challenge Incarceration Program (if deemed elgible)
Defendant IS NOT ELIGIBLE for Substance Abuse Program.
Credit for 17 days.
FORTHWITH.

superMiscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Any term deemed appropriate by Agent.
Register as a Sex Offender.
Provide DNA sample if not yet previously done.

superTimeConds.notes:
Perform 100 hours of Community Service.

AS OF 5/09/22: The Court will permit an alternate monetary payment in lieu of the community service hours, at the rate of $4.00 per hour. The defendant would owe a total of $400.00.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ryan A. Anderson in court with attorney Steven Richard Kohn.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

Count #1:

IMPOSED SENTENCE of: 

6 YEARS 6 MONTHS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 17 days) Sentence to commence forthwith. 
  -  5 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  1 YEAR 6 MONTHS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
*Any term deemed appropriate by agent.
*Register as a sex offender.
*Provide DNA sample if not yet previously done. 
*Perform 100 Hours of Community Service. 
COURT COSTS:  $268.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision);

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program. (if deemed eligible)
Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

BAIL MONEY TO BE RETURNED TO POSTER.

Hearing at 01-11-2016 10:00 am

The bond conditions modified on 12/8/15 as follows:  The Court permits use of the computer for the following: Defendant may apply and monitor for unemployment and Badger care with his father's supervision Steven Anderson for the next 30 days. Defendant not to access the internet or possess any device that can access the internet.  Defendant to have no unsupervised contact with any minor with the exception of his child.

Defendant Ryan A. Anderson in court with attorney Susan Roth for Steven R. Kohn.  Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court calls the matter to address the motion to modify the condition of bail filed by Attorney Roth.  The State objects to the request.  The Court will modify the bond as follows:  The Court permits use of the computer for the following: Defendant may apply and monitor for unemployment and Badger care with his father's supervision Steven Anderson for the next 30 days.  If additional time is requested a new motion must be filed.  Hearing scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 10:00 am.
